definitions: metal framework for cooking food over open fire
outdoor meal or gathering where food is grilled
examples: He cleaned the barbecue before grilling the steaks
The new gas barbecue has three burners
We're hosting a barbecue for the neighbors this weekend
The company barbecue attracted over two hundred employees

definitions: metal bar with weighted disks at each end for strength training
examples: She loaded the barbell with forty pounds for squats
The gym has barbells ranging from twenty to three hundred pounds

definitions: alternative spelling of barbecue for cooking equipment
alternative spelling of barbecue for outdoor cooking gathering
examples: The barbeque sauce recipe includes honey and spices
They bought a new barbeque for their patio
Everyone brought food to share at the barbeque
The annual barbeque competition draws teams nationwide

definitions: person whose occupation is cutting and styling men's hair
examples: The barber gave him a traditional straight razor shave
She visited her barber every three weeks for a trim

definitions: shop where barbers cut and style hair
style of unaccompanied vocal harmony singing
examples: The old-fashioned barbershop had a striped pole outside
He opened a barbershop on Main Street downtown
The barbershop quartet sang at the wedding reception
Barbershop harmony features close four-part vocal arrangements

definitions: poet, traditionally one reciting epics and associated with particular tradition
examples: Shakespeare is often called the Bard of Avon
The ancient bard recited tales of heroic deeds

definitions: something bought or offered for sale at favorable price
agreement between parties settling what each gives or receives
examples: She found a real bargain at the clearance sale
These shoes were a bargain at half price
They struck a bargain after hours of negotiation
The plea bargain reduced his sentence significantly

definitions: discussion of terms and conditions to reach agreement
examples: Collective bargaining determines workers' wages and conditions
The bargaining continued late into the night

definitions: flat-bottomed boat for transporting freight on canals and rivers
examples: The barge carried coal down the river to the port
Canal barges were essential for industrial transportation

definitions: action of uncovering or revealing something
examples: The baring of secrets damaged their friendship
His baring of emotions was unusual and touching

definitions: adult male singing voice between tenor and bass
brass wind instrument pitched below euphonium
examples: The baritone sang the lead role in the opera
His rich baritone voice filled the concert hall
He played baritone in the marching band
The baritone horn produces warm, mellow tones

definitions: soft silvery-white metallic element used in medical imaging
examples: The patient drank barium sulfate before the X-ray
Barium compounds are used in fireworks for green color

definitions: protective outer covering of tree trunk and branches
sharp explosive cry of a dog or similar animal
examples: The bark peeled off the birch tree in sheets
Cork is harvested from the bark of cork oak trees
The dog's bark warned us of approaching strangers
Her little bark was worse than her bite

definitions: person who stands outside shows calling for customers
dog that barks frequently or loudly
examples: The carnival barker promised amazing sights inside the tent
The barker drew crowds to the sideshow attraction
Their terrier was a persistent barker at night
The neighbor complained about our barker

definitions: cereal plant with bristly flower spikes used for food and brewing
examples: Barley is a key ingredient in beer production
They planted barley in the north field this season

definitions: woman who serves drinks in a bar or pub
examples: The barmaid knew all the regular customers by name
She worked as a barmaid while studying at university

definitions: man who serves drinks behind a bar
examples: The barman mixed cocktails with impressive flair
An experienced barman can handle the busiest nights

definitions: large farm building for storing grain, hay, or housing animals
examples: The red barn stored hay for the winter months
Cows were milked twice daily in the dairy barn

definitions: small marine crustacean that attaches permanently to rocks or ship hulls
examples: Barnacles covered the bottom of the old boat
Removing barnacles from the hull improved the ship's speed

definitions: area around a barn where farm animals are kept
examples: Chickens pecked for grain in the barnyard
The barnyard was muddy after the heavy rain

definitions: instrument measuring atmospheric pressure for weather forecasting
something that indicates changes or trends
examples: The barometer showed falling pressure before the storm
Mercury barometers were once common in homes
Stock prices serve as a barometer of economic confidence
Opinion polls are a barometer of public sentiment

definitions: member of lowest order of British nobility
powerful businessman in particular industry
examples: The baron owned vast estates in the countryside
Baron Smith attended the royal ceremony
The oil baron controlled multiple refineries
Media barons influence public opinion significantly

definitions: holder of hereditary title ranking below baron but above knight
examples: The baronet inherited his title from his father
Sir James was made a baronet for his charitable work

definitions: domain, rank, or dignity of a baron
examples: The ancient barony included three villages and surrounding lands
He inherited the barony upon his father's death

definitions: highly ornate artistic style of 17th-18th century Europe
examples: The baroque church featured elaborate gold decorations
Bach composed during the baroque period

definitions: building or group of buildings for housing soldiers
examples: Soldiers returned to the barracks after training
The old army barracks were converted into apartments

definitions: large predatory tropical marine fish with sharp teeth
examples: The barracuda swam swiftly through the coral reef
Divers spotted a six-foot barracuda near the wreck

definitions: concentrated artillery bombardment over wide area
overwhelming number of questions, criticisms, or complaints
examples: The artillery barrage lasted for three hours
Enemy positions were destroyed by the barrage
She faced a barrage of questions from reporters
The company received a barrage of complaints
